wikipedia_page.main: Richard Anthony Appleby Holt (11 March 1920 – 18 May 2001) was an English cricketer active from 1938 to 1947 who played for Sussex. He was born and died in Kensington. He appeared in six first-class matches as a righthanded batsman who scored 60 runs with a highest score of 30.

response: Richard Holt (1931–1991) was a British Conservative Member of Parliament.
